page.title: 05LONG ISLAND NEAR ARNE
page.content: Long Island lies to the East of the Arne Peninsula and to the North of Round Island to which it is linked by a narrow spit of salt marsh. Long Island is not populated.It is owned by Major Ryder of the Rempstone Estate. The whole Island is very wild and thus of scientific interest because it is so natural.The soil is sandy and as yet no fresh water has been found,which is the main reason for there being no inhabitants.The Island is not part of the Nature Reserve but the RSPB guard it because of its bird colonies. The Island is not used for anything specific but just leased out occasionally for the use of camping or sailing clubs.This is unlike Round Island which is private property and to which the public have no access.
